answers.answer: I was a couple days overdue and doctors said babygirl was 10lbs so they induced me. I was fine the night I was admitted but the next day they started pitocin. The drip they had me on wasnt working so they decided to up the drip. Well they upped it too much and my contractions were unbareable. So once again they changed the drip to a slower speed. I refused any meds so it was painful but it was all worth it. I had a beautiful 8lb baby after 13 hrs. :) good luck hun im sure youll do great
Wow! I'm planning on no meds as well. That's awesome. They're planning on upping it in the morning. You made it seem so easy. Thank you for sharing (:

Went in for induction sunday since I was only 50% effaced and half centimeter dilated. Well they gave me a pill to take every 4 hours to help soften cervix. I started first one and didnt notice anything until end of the 4th hour I began to feel small contractions. Then walked a bit took another pill and contractions picked up and came more often... well I was on monitors the whole time an baby was fine then suddenly her heart rate dropped to 50 and nurses an doctor came running in and called a code C ended up with an emergency c section and had to be put under for my safety and babies. They dont know what caused it or why it happened.
Are you and your baby okay? I hope I don't need a c section..
We are great healthy happy baby and im great as well I was planning on vaginal delivery which didnt happen but we are great and already home I had her sunday night and came home this morning
Started my pitocin around 5pm contractions started about an hr later got the epidural around midnight had my baby girl at 5:55 am

My first pregnancy I also had developed preclampsia. Doctor sent me to the hospital, and they started my drip at about 1pm. I was annoyed because I hadn't eaten and they wouldn't let me eat. I opted for the epidural, but wish I hadn't now. Try really hard not to give into the pain, because I couldn't push my daughter out properly because I couldn't feel the contractions or my hips. I had my daughter at 6:33am the next morning after they had to use a device to help pull her out.

I'm being induced right now! And it's terrible.  I git here at 9am Tuesday morning (yesterday) got a cervidil in at 11 am they left that in for 12 hours.  Took it out at 11pm. I was 2 cm when they put it in and only 3 12 hours later with the cervidil.  Started pitocin at 1am. Stopped it at almost 3 and gave me morphine so I could sleep alil. I was at a 4 at 2:30 am. It's now 6 am and still the same I feel. Idk I havnt been checked. Waiting for my doctor to wake up. But this is the slowest process. I regret agreeing to this!

I had a 2 day induction the 15-16th at 41 weeks he was born. I got cersivil Sunday night and pitocin Monday morning, labor was 26 hours and only pushed for 45 minutes.. I opted for the epidural but it didn't work one bit, so I felt everything! It got real bad at 6-7cm. I went from 7cm to the birth of my son in an hour and 10 minutes!! I dilated from 7 to a 9.5 in about 25 minutes!! At 9cm my contractions were to the point where my body started to automatically push and I couldn't help it but to push! They let me start pushing with the nurse at 9.5 cm while the Dr got prepared. Once Dr was set it took 4 big pushes and he was out! I won't sugar coat it when I say it was and will ever be the worst pain of my life, but the power and accomplishment you feel when you don't have pain meds is incredible. Its worth it and deep down I'm so thankful my epidural didn't work! Good luck to you momma:)

830/845 cervidil was inserted to help with the thinning of my cervix and within the hour contractions started. At the time I was only 1 cm about 50% effaced. When I was checked after the 12 hrs I was 80% effaced and dilated to 2.  By 815 cervidil was removed and pitocin was started. 930 got epiduraldilated to 3 and at 11 doctor broke my water.  At 1130 I was still only  3 cm but completely soft and effaced.  Due to the pressure I was feeling in my bottom and girly parts they decided to check our progress at 1230 and I was dilated to 6. I was then put on oxygen mask and pitocin was stopped since her heart was was dipping again and they were unsure of the cause. Midwife was called to help insert a monitor to see why baby girls heart rate was fluctuating. Midwife showed up at 1250 checked my progress and I was already dilated to 9 without the continuation of pitocin by 1 they wanted to try a practice push to see how it would go and by 1:17 pm she was born. 10 minutes of pushing and just about 4 hours of active labor

question: Anybody that's been induced, can you please share your story? I'm in the hospital and they're starting me on oxytocin to induce me tomorrow due to preeclampsia. What were you're experiences like? This is my first baby, and I don't know what to expect..
title: Induction.
